column4: iÂ´ve bougth a acer aspire one last week and dident work, i had to setup madwifi by hand
I'm surprised at that, did you have to compile from source?
yeah
was it the ng (new generation) code base you had to use?
that one, madwifi_ng
sorry to hassle you.. after the installation did you have to modprobe ath_pci ?
its ok dude :), i just load it with the drivers app menu, same as doing with modprobe
ok cool
have fun with atheros :)
yeah
can you provide info or url?
sure
this one whas my bug, https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/228548
before i read, was there a fix or workaround discussed?
yeah i get it working building mandwifi, looking fot the url, one sec
yeah we just did that, built madwif then did modpribe ath_pci etc
you grabed this one? -> madwifi-hal-0.10.5.6-r3861-20080903.tar.gz
yup
did you have to modprobe anything after install?
so you unloaded (rmmod) old drivers, deleted the old atheros modules (rm -rf) and compiled the new ones and loaded again (modprobe) and still dont work?
we didnt use the driver you just linked us to , we used an older one, thats probs where the issue was
this isnt for me, this is just me helping someone out, I didnt realise this was a known bug to begin with
ah ok, now i understand :)
